techmeme.title: Amazon says it's investing $1B+ to raise pay for US fulfillment and transportation staff, increasing the average total compensation to $30+/hour with benefits (Reuters)
Lyft partners with Waymo to launch fully autonomous robotaxi rides in Nashville starting in 2026, their first collaboration; LYFT jumps 10% (Natalie Lung/Bloomberg)
Amazon debuts a chatbot-style assistant to help advertisers use AI to make ads, which can run across Amazon's ad inventory and platforms that have Amazon deals (Patrick Coffee/Wall Street Journal)
The UK FCA plans to exempt cryptoasset providers from some of its finance rules, as it prepares to integrate the sector into its regulatory framework from 2026 (Martin Arnold/Financial Times)
Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang says he was "disappointed" after The Financial Times reported that China has banned Chinese companies from using Nvidia's RTX Pro 6000D (Ryan Browne/CNBC)
